title: (x) Handwriting - Handy Script {Ray Wrona (self)}
content:
I was told the font used for "carried away cuisine & catering" was called Handwriting Regular. But in searching for that name, I cannot find it anywhere. Any ideas? ![Cucina Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212015720im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/50052.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Ben & Jerry's Font Help](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212015720/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6910 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Boss Cargo Limited - Antique Olive {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212015720/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6915 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content:
Well, the good news is that I can confirm that the font is   
called Handwriting. See [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212015720/http:/www.myfonts.com/FontForums/read.php?f=5&i=32748&t=32733) MyFonts Forums thread.   
   
I have no idea where to find it, though.

I have this font and the only foundry info I have is "Fontographer". It is indeed called Handwriting. No clue where I got it...   
   
Google is no help whatsoever on this one.   
   
Sorry
I have it on my Mac and just converted it to pc... but don't know where I got it...
You guys are amazing! I am going to try and contact the creator of the logo, in hopes that he has the info...if I find out anything, I will certainly let you know. Thanks for your help!

Aha ... it's a [Sam Wang font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212015720/http:/www.graphic-design.com/Type/Fonts-Fonts/scripts/handwrite.html). He was one of the very   
early shareware font makers (like Rakowski).   
   
I wouldn't be surprised if it only exists in Mac format.

Yeah, I remember buying a floppy disk from him with some of his fonts in the early 90's. His fonts were mostly shareware, and if you registered by sending the fee, he sent you a disk with more fonts on it.

I found it! One of my fellow iStockphoto.com members found it, actually. It is called Handy Script and is available at graphxedge.com   
Thank you for the help, and I am sure I will be back!
